methods.javadoc: Add a marker at the address.
methods.name: add
methods.comment: Add a marker at the address.

methods.javadoc: Add the range given the start and end of the range.
methods.name: add
methods.comment: Add the range given the start and end of the range.

methods.javadoc: Add a marker across the address range.
methods.name: add
methods.comment: Add a marker across the address range.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the AddressSetCollection to be used for this this marker set.

Warning! Using this method will cause this MarkerSet to directly use the given AddressSetCollection. If the given AddressSetCollection is not an instance of ModifiableAddressSetCollection, then the markerSet methods that add and remove addresses will thrown an IllegalArgumentException. @param set the addressSetCollection to use as this markerSet's addressSetCollection.
methods.name: setAddressSetCollection
methods.comment:
Sets the AddressSetCollection to be used for this this marker set. 
 Warning! 
 Using this method will cause this MarkerSet to directly use the given AddressSetCollection.
 If the given AddressSetCollection is not an instance of ModifiableAddressSetCollection,
 then the markerSet methods that add and remove addresses will thrown an
 IllegalArgumentException.

params.name: set
params.comment: the addressSetCollection to use as this markerSet's addressSetCollection.

methods.name: setAddressSet
methods.comment:
Clears the current set off addresses in this markerSet and adds in the addresses
 from the given AddressSet.

params.name: set
params.comment: the set of addresses to use in this marker set.

methods.javadoc: Add a marker at each address in the given address set.
methods.name: add
methods.comment: Add a marker at each address in the given address set.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Determine if this marker set contains the specified address.

return.comment: true if marker set contains addr.

methods.javadoc: Return the address set for this marker set.
methods.name: getAddressSet
methods.comment: Return the address set for this marker set.

methods.javadoc: Clear any marker at the address.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear any marker at the address.

methods.javadoc: Clear any marker across the address range.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear any marker across the address range.

methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Remove the given range from the marker set.

params.name: start
params.comment: the start of the range to remove.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end of the range to remove.

methods.javadoc: Clear any marker at each address in the address set.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear any marker at each address in the address set.

methods.javadoc: Return the name of this MarkerSet.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Return the name of this MarkerSet.

methods.javadoc: Clear all defined markers.
methods.name: clearAll
methods.comment: Clear all defined markers.

methods.javadoc: Get display priority.
methods.name: getPriority
methods.comment: Get display priority.

methods.javadoc:
Gets whether this marker is in the preferred group when determining display priority.
 Typically point markers are in the preferred group and area markers are not.
methods.name: isPreferred
methods.comment:
Gets whether this marker is in the preferred group when determining display priority.
 Typically point markers are in the preferred group and area markers are not.

methods.javadoc: Return true if this marker set is active.
methods.name: setActive
methods.comment: Return true if this marker set is active.

methods.javadoc: Get the color for the marker.
methods.name: getMarkerColor
methods.comment: Get the color for the marker.

methods.javadoc:
Set the color for the marker.
@param color marker color
methods.name: setMarkerColor
methods.comment: Set the color for the marker.

methods.javadoc:
Set the marker manager listener to use for user interaction
 with markers owned by this manager.
methods.name: setNavigationListener
methods.comment:
Set the marker manager listener to use for user interaction
 with markers owned by this manager.

methods.javadoc:
@return true if this marker manager displays in the right
           hand navigation bar.
methods.name: isDisplayedInNavigationBar

return.comment:
true if this marker manager displays in the right
           hand navigation bar.

methods.javadoc:
@return true if this marker manager displays in the left
           hand marker bar.
methods.name: displayInMarkerBar

return.comment:
true if this marker manager displays in the left
           hand marker bar.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this MarkerSet is coloring the background in the listing for locations
 contained in this MarkerSet.
methods.name: isColoringBackground
methods.comment:
Returns true if this MarkerSet is coloring the background in the listing for locations
 contained in this MarkerSet.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this MarkerSet is active.  Being "active" means that it is displayed
 in the listing.
methods.name: isActive
methods.comment:
Returns true if this MarkerSet is active.  Being "active" means that it is displayed
 in the listing.

methods.name: setColoringBackground
methods.comment:
Sets whether or not the MarkerSet is coloring the background of areas in the listing
 contained in this MarkerSet.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the minimum Address in this MarkerSet;
@return the minimum Address in this MarkerSet;
methods.name: getMinAddress
methods.comment: Returns the minimum Address in this MarkerSet;

return.comment: the minimum Address in this MarkerSet;

methods.javadoc:
Returns the maximum Address in this MarkerSet;
@return the maximum Address in this MarkerSet;
methods.name: getMaxAddress
methods.comment: Returns the maximum Address in this MarkerSet;

return.comment: the maximum Address in this MarkerSet;

methods.name: intersects
methods.comment:
Returns true if any address in this MarkerSet is contained in the range defined by
 start and end.

params.name: start
params.comment: the start address of the range to check for intersection.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end address of the range to check for intersection.

return.comment: true if the set of addresses contained in this MarkerSet intersects the given range.

name: MarkerSet
comment:
Defines methods for working with a set of addresses that correspond to
 markers.
